[[University of California, Berkeley]] | doctoral_advisor = [[Raymond Neutra]] | doctoral_students = | known_for = | awards = }} '''Sander Greenland''' (born January 16, 1951) is an [[United States|American]] [[statistician]] and [[epidemiologist]] known for his contributions to epidemiologic methods, [[meta-analysis]], [[Bayesian inference]] and [[causality|causal inference]], among other topics. Educated at the [[University of California, Berkeley]] and the [[University of California, Los Angeles]] (UCLA), he has held a professorship in epidemiology at UCLA School of Public Health since 1989, and additionally a professorship in statistics at UCLA College of Letters and Science since 1999. Greenland has published over 300 scientific papers, two of which have been cited over 500 times.{{cite journal | author = Greenland, S. | year = 1989 | title = Modeling and variable selection in epidemiologic analysis | journal = American Journal of Public Health | volume = 79 | issue = 3 | pages = 340–349 | url = http://www.ajph.org/cgi/content/abstract/79/3/340 | pmid = 2916724 | doi = 10.2105/AJPH.79.3.340 | pmc = 1349563 }}{{cite journal | author = Greenland, S. | date = January 1, 1987 | title = Quantitative methods in the review of epidemiologic literature | journal = Epidemiologic Reviews | volume = 9 | issue = 1 | pages = 1–30 | url = http://epirev.oxfordjournals.org/cgi/content/citation/9/1/1 | pmid = 3678409 }} He is the co-author of one of the major textbooks on epidemiology currently in its 3rd edition.{{cite book | author = Rothman, K.J. |author2=Greenland, S. |author3=Lash, T.L. | year = 2008 | title = Modern Epidemiology | publisher = Lippincott Williams & Wilkins | isbn = 0-7817-5564-6 | edition = 3rd }} He was made a [[American Statistical Association#Fellowship|Fellow of the American Statistical Association]] in 1998.{{cite web|url=http://www.amstat.org/careers/fellowslist.cfm|title=ASA Fellows|publisher=American Statistical Association|accessdate=2011-02-15}} He is also an Associate Editor of the Dictionary of Epidemiology sponsored by the [[International Epidemiological Association]].[[Miquel Porta]], editor.
